acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 48 hours EC50=0.014ppm of the crustacea (Daphnia magna) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data, 2002).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (dermal route) value of 1,400mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (2005)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Classification cannot be determined, though the available rat inhalation study reported the LC50 value of >0.625mg/L (4 hours) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (2005)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is a liquid according to the GHS criteria and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 1,750mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (2005)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: There was no treatment-related increase in tumor incidence observed in rat and mouse carcinogenicity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (2005)).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since acute toxicity was Category 1 and there was no rapidly degrading (BIOWIN), and since there wasbio-accumulation (log Kow=5 (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), it was classified into Category 1.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

explosives.rationale: Being an acetylene compound, the substance contains chemical groups with explosive properties, but its oxygen budget is calculated at -214, that is "Not classified."

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on negative data in in vitro reverse mutation tests, in vitro chromosome aberration tests and micronucleus tests on in vivo mouse bone marrow cells (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (2005)).

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Cannot be classified though being organic compounds containing oxygen bound to elements other than carbon and hydrogen

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Considered non-pyrophoric when in contact with air at ordinary temperatures since the substance is stable to heat (up to 170degC) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data).

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Based on no evidence of adverse effects on reproduction or offspring development observed in rat reproduction studies and rat/rabbit teratogenicity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (2005)).

self_heating_substances.rationale: Stable to heat (up to 170degC) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data)

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though being an acetylene compound containing chemical groups with explosive properties.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the evidence of irreversible irritation observed in rabbit eye irritation tests (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (2005)).

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit skin irritation tests performed according to EPA Guideline 81-4 (IUCLID (2000)): "Moderately irritating."

skin_sensitizer.hazard_statement: May cause an allergic skin reaction
skin_sensitizer.rationale: Based on positive results in guinea pig skin sensitization tests employing the Draize method (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (2005)).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (blood system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including "decreased hematocrit/hemoglobin/RBC." These effects were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
